main.message: Hi! I'm SIFTHR, your scam prevention assistant. How can I help you today?

options.text: How do I report a scam?

detect_fake_ad.message: Let me help you identify if an ad might be fake. What makes you suspicious?

options.text: The offer seems too good to be true

too_good.message:
üö® Red Flag! If an offer seems too good to be true, it probably is. Common signs:

‚Ä¢ Promises of easy money
‚Ä¢ Unrealistic discounts (90%+ off)
‚Ä¢ Guaranteed wins or returns
‚Ä¢ Pressure to act immediately

Recommendation: Do NOT click or engage. Check out our module on identifying fake offers!

asking_info.message:
‚ö†Ô∏è Warning! Legitimate ads rarely ask for:

‚Ä¢ Social Security numbers
‚Ä¢ Bank account details
‚Ä¢ Passwords or PINs
‚Ä¢ Copy of ID or passport

NEVER share this information through social media ads or messages!

options.text: How do I verify if it's legit?

clicked_link.message:
Don't panic! Here's what to do:

1. Do NOT enter any personal information
2. Close the page immediately
3. Clear your browser cache
4. Run antivirus scan
5. Change passwords for important accounts

Did you enter any information on the page?

options.text: How do I scan for malware?

just_clicked.message:
Good! Since you didn't enter any information, your risk is lower. However:

‚úì Clear your browser cache and cookies
‚úì Run an antivirus scan to be safe
‚úì Monitor your accounts for unusual activity
‚úì Be extra cautious of similar ads

You should be okay if you take these precautions!

options.text: How do I avoid this in the future?

gave_info.message: ‚ö†Ô∏è URGENT ACTION NEEDED! What type of information did you share?

gave_financial.message:
üö® IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED:

1. Contact your bank/card issuer NOW
2. Freeze or cancel the card
3. Monitor transactions daily
4. File a fraud report
5. Consider credit monitoring service

USA: Call 1-877-FTC-HELP (382-4357)
Philippines: Contact BSP at (02) 8708-7087

gave_identity.message:
üö® CRITICAL - Identity Theft Risk:

1. Place fraud alert with credit bureaus
2. File identity theft report with FTC
3. Monitor credit reports
4. Consider credit freeze
5. Report to local authorities

You may be at risk of identity theft. Take these steps immediately!

options.text: How do I file a report?

gave_credentials.message:
‚ö†Ô∏è Account Compromise Risk:

1. Change password IMMEDIATELY on all accounts using that password
2. Enable two-factor authentication (2FA)
3. Check for unauthorized access
4. Review recent account activity
5. Notify contacts if email was compromised

Do this NOW before scammers can use your credentials!

options.text: What if they already accessed my account?

sent_money.message: How did you send the money?

sent_card.message:
Contact your card issuer IMMEDIATELY:

1. Call the number on back of your card
2. Report unauthorized transaction
3. Request chargeback
4. They may freeze/replace card

Time is critical - most banks have a dispute window of 60-120 days!

options.text: How do I file a chargeback?

sent_bank.message:
Act FAST:

1. Contact your bank immediately
2. Request transfer reversal (may be possible within 24 hours)
3. File fraud report
4. Contact recipient bank if known
5. Report to authorities

Bank transfers are harder to reverse, so speed is essential!

options.text: Can I get my money back?

sent_giftcard.message:
‚ö†Ô∏è Gift cards are a scammer's favorite because they're nearly impossible to trace or reverse.

1. Contact the gift card company immediately
2. Provide card number and receipt
3. They may freeze remaining balance
4. File police report
5. Report to FTC

Unfortunately, recovery is unlikely, but reporting helps stop others from being scammed.

report_scam.message:
Here's how to report:

üá∫üá∏ USA:
‚Ä¢ FTC: reportfraud.ftc.gov
‚Ä¢ FBI IC3: ic3.gov
‚Ä¢ Call: 1-877-FTC-HELP

üáµüá≠ Philippines:
‚Ä¢ NBI Cybercrime: cybercrime@nbi.gov.ph
‚Ä¢ PNP ACG: (02) 8723-0401

üì± Social Media:
‚Ä¢ Report the ad/profile on the platform
‚Ä¢ Screenshot everything as evidence

options.text: What information do I need to report?

scam_types.message:
Common scam types on social media:

1. üéÅ Too-good-to-be-true offers
2. üí∞ Investment/pyramid schemes  
3. üõçÔ∏è Fake online shops
4. üí≥ Phishing for credentials
5. üíï Romance scams
6. üéØ Prize/lottery scams
7. üëî Fake job offers

Want to learn more about any of these?

prevention_tips.message:
üõ°Ô∏è Stay Safe Online:

‚úì Verify seller reviews & ratings
‚úì Check for secure payment methods
‚úì Never share personal info in ads
‚úì Use official websites, not links in ads
‚úì Trust your instincts
‚úì Research before buying

Want to learn more? Check out our modules!

modules_redirect.message: Great! I'll take you to our learning modules where you can get comprehensive education on scam prevention.

no_reviews.message:
‚ö†Ô∏è No reviews or ratings is a major red flag! Scammers often create new accounts.

What to check:
‚Ä¢ Account creation date (very new = suspicious)
‚Ä¢ Number of followers/likes
‚Ä¢ Comments on other posts
‚Ä¢ Reverse image search the profile picture

Recommendation: AVOID sellers with no history!

options.text: How do I verify a seller?
What else should I look for?

low_price.message:
üö® Extremely low prices are a classic scam tactic!

Red flags:
‚Ä¢ 80-90% off retail price
‚Ä¢ 'Limited time only' pressure
‚Ä¢ Payment only through wire transfer or gift cards
‚Ä¢ Seller won't use secure payment platforms

Tip: If the price is unbelievable, it's probably fake!

options.text: How can I check if it's real?

what_to_do_suspicious.message:
If you suspect a scam:

‚úì Do NOT click any links
‚úì Do NOT provide any information
‚úì Screenshot the ad as evidence
‚úì Report it on the platform
‚úì Block the sender

Your instincts are usually right - better safe than sorry!

verify_seller.message:
How to verify a seller:

1. Check account age and activity
2. Read reviews carefully (watch for fake reviews)
3. Google the business name + 'scam' or 'review'
4. Verify contact information
5. Check if they have a real website
6. Use reverse image search on product photos
7. Only use secure payment platforms with buyer protection

options.text: What are red flags in reviews?

malware_scan.message:
How to scan for malware:

1. Use Windows Defender (built-in)
   ‚Ä¢ Settings > Update & Security > Windows Security
2. Download Malwarebytes (free version available)
3. Run a full system scan
4. Check browser extensions for suspicious ones
5. Clear browser cache and cookies

If found, follow removal instructions immediately!

gave_contact.message:
Contact info (phone/address) is less critical but still risky:

1. Be alert for:
   ‚Ä¢ Spam calls/texts
   ‚Ä¢ Phishing attempts
   ‚Ä¢ Identity theft attempts
2. Don't answer unknown numbers
3. Report spam messages
4. Monitor for suspicious activity

Consider changing your phone number if harassment continues.

identity_protection.message:
Additional identity protection steps:

1. File police report immediately
2. Place fraud alert with credit bureaus
3. Get free credit reports and review them
4. Consider identity theft insurance
5. Keep detailed records of everything
6. Check government benefits accounts

This is serious - don't wait!

options.text: How do I contact credit bureaus?

credit_freeze_info.message:
Credit Freeze (Security Freeze):

What it does:
‚Ä¢ Prevents new credit accounts from being opened in your name
‚Ä¢ Free to place and lift
‚Ä¢ Doesn't affect existing accounts or credit score

How to do it:
Contact all 3 major credit bureaus:
‚Ä¢ Equifax
‚Ä¢ Experian
‚Ä¢ TransUnion

You'll need to unfreeze temporarily when applying for credit yourself.

options.text: How do I contact credit bureaus?

enable_2fa.message:
How to enable Two-Factor Authentication (2FA):

1. Go to account security settings
2. Look for '2FA', 'Two-Step Verification', or 'Multi-Factor Authentication'
3. Choose authentication method:
   ‚Ä¢ Authenticator app (most secure - Google Authenticator, Authy)
   ‚Ä¢ SMS (less secure but better than nothing)
4. Save backup codes in a safe place

Major platforms:
‚Ä¢ Google: myaccount.google.com/security
‚Ä¢ Facebook: Settings > Security
‚Ä¢ Email providers: Check security settings

options.text: Which authenticator app should I use?

account_compromised.message:
If your account is already compromised:

1. Try to change password immediately
2. If locked out, use account recovery
3. Contact platform support
4. Warn your contacts about possible scam messages from your account
5. Check connected apps and revoke suspicious ones
6. Review recent activity/posts

For major platforms:
‚Ä¢ Facebook: facebook.com/hacked
‚Ä¢ Google: support.google.com/accounts
‚Ä¢ Email: Use provider's account recovery

options.text: How do I recover my account?

sent_cashapp.message:
Cash apps (Venmo, PayPal, CashApp, etc.):

1. Contact the app support IMMEDIATELY
2. Report the transaction as fraud
3. Request cancellation (only possible if payment is pending)
4. File a dispute if payment was for goods/services
5. Contact your bank if linked to card

Note: Person-to-person payments are harder to reverse. Most apps don't offer buyer protection for P2P transfers.

sent_crypto.message:
‚ö†Ô∏è Cryptocurrency transactions are IRREVERSIBLE and anonymous.

Unfortunately:
‚Ä¢ Cannot be reversed or canceled
‚Ä¢ Very difficult to trace
‚Ä¢ No buyer protection
‚Ä¢ Recovery is nearly impossible

What you can do:
1. Report to local authorities
2. Report to FBI IC3 (ic3.gov)
3. Report to crypto exchange if used
4. Document everything for police report

Learn from this - never send crypto to unverified sellers!

chargeback_info.message:
How to file a chargeback:

1. Contact your card issuer (number on back of card)
2. Explain it was a fraudulent transaction
3. Provide evidence:
   ‚Ä¢ Screenshots of the ad
   ‚Ä¢ Communication with seller
   ‚Ä¢ Any promises made
4. File within 60-120 days of transaction
5. They'll investigate (may take 30-90 days)

Success rate is higher if you:
‚Ä¢ Report quickly
‚Ä¢ Have good documentation
‚Ä¢ Never received goods/services

recovery_chances.message:
Your chances of recovering money depend on:

HIGH chance:
‚Ä¢ Credit/debit card (chargeback rights)
‚Ä¢ PayPal Goods & Services
‚Ä¢ Bank transfer caught within 24 hours

MEDIUM chance:
‚Ä¢ Bank transfer after 24 hours
‚Ä¢ Some payment apps with buyer protection

LOW chance:
‚Ä¢ Gift cards
‚Ä¢ Cryptocurrency
‚Ä¢ Wire transfers
‚Ä¢ Person-to-person cash apps

Always report even if recovery is unlikely - it helps authorities track scammers!

options.text: How do I file a chargeback?

report_info_needed.message:
When reporting a scam, gather:

üì∏ Evidence:
‚Ä¢ Screenshots of ads/messages
‚Ä¢ Email headers
‚Ä¢ URLs/website addresses
‚Ä¢ Photos of any products received

üìã Details:
‚Ä¢ Date and time of incident
‚Ä¢ Amount of money lost
‚Ä¢ Payment method used
‚Ä¢ Scammer's contact info (phone, email, username)
‚Ä¢ Description of what happened

üí∞ Financial:
‚Ä¢ Transaction IDs
‚Ä¢ Bank statements
‚Ä¢ Receipts

investment_scams.message:
Investment/Pyramid Scams:

Red Flags:
‚Ä¢ Guaranteed high returns with 'no risk'
‚Ä¢ 'Get rich quick' promises
‚Ä¢ Pressure to recruit others
‚Ä¢ Complicated compensation structure
‚Ä¢ Requires upfront investment
‚Ä¢ Uses terms like 'passive income' heavily

Common ones:
‚Ä¢ Cryptocurrency 'investments'
‚Ä¢ Multi-level marketing (MLM)
‚Ä¢ Forex trading 'opportunities'
‚Ä¢ Binary options

Rule: If it sounds too good to be true, it is!

options.text: How do I spot a pyramid scheme?

fake_shops.message:
Fake Online Shops:

Warning Signs:
‚Ä¢ Website is very new (check domain age)
‚Ä¢ No physical address or contact info
‚Ä¢ Only accepts untraceable payment methods
‚Ä¢ Prices too good to be true
‚Ä¢ Poor grammar/spelling
‚Ä¢ Stolen product images (use reverse image search)
‚Ä¢ No return policy or unrealistic policies
‚Ä¢ Suspicious domain name (slight misspellings of real brands)

Protection:
‚úì Use PayPal or credit cards (buyer protection)
‚úì Research the store name + 'scam'
‚úì Check reviews on independent sites

options.text: How do I check if a site is safe?
I already ordered from a fake shop

fake_reviews.message:
Spotting fake reviews:

üö© Red Flags:
‚Ä¢ All 5-star or all similar ratings
‚Ä¢ Generic comments ('Great product!', 'Love it!')
‚Ä¢ Reviews posted on same day
‚Ä¢ Overly enthusiastic language
‚Ä¢ No specific product details
‚Ä¢ Reviewer has only reviewed this seller
‚Ä¢ Poor grammar in supposedly US/UK reviews

‚úì Look for:
‚Ä¢ Mix of ratings
‚Ä¢ Specific details about product
‚Ä¢ Photos from buyers
‚Ä¢ Reviews over time period
‚Ä¢ Negative reviews with seller responses

options.text: How else can I verify sellers?

safe_payments.message:
Safe payment methods (in order):

1. ‚úÖ Credit cards (best protection, easy chargebacks)
2. ‚úÖ PayPal Goods & Services (buyer protection)
3. ‚úÖ Secure payment platforms (Stripe, Square)
4. ‚ö†Ô∏è Debit cards (some protection, less than credit)

AVOID:
‚ùå Wire transfers
‚ùå Gift cards
‚ùå Cryptocurrency
‚ùå Cash apps for goods (Venmo, CashApp P2P)
‚ùå Money orders

Rule: If seller insists on unsafe payment methods, it's a scam!

malware_found.message:
If malware is detected:

1. Follow removal tool instructions
2. Change ALL passwords after removal
3. Check for:
   ‚Ä¢ New programs you didn't install
   ‚Ä¢ Browser homepage changes
   ‚Ä¢ New browser extensions
4. Review bank/credit card statements
5. Enable 2FA on important accounts
6. Run scan again to confirm removal

If you can't remove it, consider professional help or factory reset (backup important files first!).

options.text: How do I change passwords safely?

block_spam.message:
How to block spam calls/texts:

iPhone:
‚Ä¢ Settings > Phone > Silence Unknown Callers
‚Ä¢ Messages > Filter Unknown Senders
‚Ä¢ Block individual numbers in recent calls

Android:
‚Ä¢ Phone app > Settings > Blocked numbers
‚Ä¢ Messages app > spam protection settings
‚Ä¢ Use built-in spam filter

Third-party apps:
‚Ä¢ Truecaller
‚Ä¢ Hiya
‚Ä¢ RoboKiller

Report to carrier:
‚Ä¢ Forward spam texts to 7726 (SPAM)

credit_bureaus.message:
Contact credit bureaus:

üìû Equifax
‚Ä¢ Website: equifax.com
‚Ä¢ Phone: 1-800-685-1111
‚Ä¢ Freeze: equifax.com/personal/credit-report-services

üìû Experian
‚Ä¢ Website: experian.com
‚Ä¢ Phone: 1-888-397-3742
‚Ä¢ Freeze: experian.com/freeze

üìû TransUnion
‚Ä¢ Website: transunion.com
‚Ä¢ Phone: 1-888-909-8872
‚Ä¢ Freeze: transunion.com/credit-freeze

You must contact ALL THREE for complete protection!

authenticator_apps.message:
Best authenticator apps:

1. ‚úÖ Google Authenticator
   ‚Ä¢ Free, simple, reliable
   ‚Ä¢ iOS & Android

2. ‚úÖ Microsoft Authenticator
   ‚Ä¢ Free, cloud backup
   ‚Ä¢ iOS & Android

3. ‚úÖ Authy
   ‚Ä¢ Free, multi-device sync
   ‚Ä¢ iOS, Android, Desktop

4. ‚úÖ 1Password/Bitwarden
   ‚Ä¢ Built into password managers

Avoid SMS-based 2FA when possible (can be intercepted). Authenticator apps are more secure!

account_recovery.message:
Account recovery steps:

1. Use 'Forgot Password' or 'Can't access account'
2. Verify identity with:
   ‚Ä¢ Recovery email
   ‚Ä¢ Phone number
   ‚Ä¢ Security questions
   ‚Ä¢ Trusted contacts
3. Follow platform's recovery process
4. Provide proof of identity if needed
5. Contact support if automated recovery fails

Platform-specific help:
‚Ä¢ Facebook: facebook.com/hacked
‚Ä¢ Google: google.com/accounts/recovery
‚Ä¢ Instagram: help.instagram.com
‚Ä¢ Twitter: help.twitter.com

buyer_protection.message:
Payment apps with buyer protection:

‚úÖ GOOD Protection:
‚Ä¢ PayPal Goods & Services
‚Ä¢ Credit cards
‚Ä¢ Debit cards (limited)

‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED/NO Protection for P2P:
‚Ä¢ Venmo (no protection for P2P)
‚Ä¢ CashApp (no protection)
‚Ä¢ Zelle (no protection)
‚Ä¢ Apple Pay Cash (no protection)
‚Ä¢ Google Pay P2P (no protection)

IMPORTANT: These apps are designed for sending money to people you TRUST, not for buying from strangers!

Always use PayPal Goods & Services or credit cards for online purchases!

evidence_needed.message:
Evidence for chargebacks/disputes:

üì∏ Screenshots:
‚Ä¢ The advertisement
‚Ä¢ Product description/promises
‚Ä¢ All messages with seller
‚Ä¢ Order confirmation
‚Ä¢ Shipping/tracking info (if any)

üìÑ Documentation:
‚Ä¢ Bank/card statements
‚Ä¢ Receipts or invoices
‚Ä¢ Timeline of events
‚Ä¢ Any contracts or agreements

üìù Description:
‚Ä¢ What was promised
‚Ä¢ What you received (or didn't receive)
‚Ä¢ Steps you took to resolve
‚Ä¢ Seller's response (or lack of)

More evidence = better chance of success!

options.text: How do I file a chargeback?

pyramid_scheme.message:
Pyramid Scheme Red Flags:

üö© Focus on recruiting over selling products
üö© Pay to join or buy starter kit
üö© Income comes from recruits, not sales
üö© 'Unlimited earning potential'
üö© Pressure to recruit friends/family
üö© Complex commission structure
üö© Emphasis on 'lifestyle' and 'being your own boss'
üö© No genuine product or service

Legal MLM vs Pyramid Scheme:
‚Ä¢ Legal: Income from product sales
‚Ä¢ Illegal: Income from recruiting

If you can't make money without recruiting, it's likely a pyramid scheme!

options.text: I'm already involved, what do I do?

gift_card_scams.message:
Why gift cards are a scammer's favorite:

‚ùå Untraceable - can't track who uses them
‚ùå Non-refundable - money is gone once code is used
‚ùå Instant - scammer gets money immediately
‚ùå Anonymous - no identity verification needed

üö® REMEMBER:
‚Ä¢ Real businesses NEVER ask for gift cards as payment
‚Ä¢ Government agencies NEVER demand gift cards
‚Ä¢ No legitimate service accepts only gift cards

If someone insists on gift card payment, it's 100% a scam!

password_security.message:
Creating secure passwords:

‚úÖ DO:
‚Ä¢ Use 12+ characters
‚Ä¢ Mix letters, numbers, symbols
‚Ä¢ Use unique password for each account
‚Ä¢ Use a password manager (LastPass, 1Password, Bitwarden)
‚Ä¢ Use passphrases: 'Coffee!Beach@Sunset2024'

‚ùå DON'T:
‚Ä¢ Use personal info (birthday, name)
‚Ä¢ Reuse passwords
‚Ä¢ Use common words or patterns
‚Ä¢ Share passwords
‚Ä¢ Write them down (except in password manager)

Change passwords every 3-6 months for critical accounts!

persistent_harassment.message:
If spam/scam calls persist:

1. Document everything:
   ‚Ä¢ Date and time of calls
   ‚Ä¢ Phone numbers
   ‚Ä¢ What they say

2. File complaints:
   ‚Ä¢ FTC: donotcall.gov
   ‚Ä¢ FCC: consumercomplaints.fcc.gov
   ‚Ä¢ Your phone carrier

3. Legal options:
   ‚Ä¢ Police report for harassment
   ‚Ä¢ Restraining order if threats made
   ‚Ä¢ Consider legal action under TCPA

4. Last resort:
   ‚Ä¢ Change your phone number
   ‚Ä¢ Use call screening service

options.text: How do I file a complaint?

account_recovery_failed.message:
If automated recovery fails:

1. Contact platform support directly:
   ‚Ä¢ Use 'Help' or 'Support' on login page
   ‚Ä¢ Provide government ID for verification
   ‚Ä¢ Explain situation clearly

2. Social media escalation:
   ‚Ä¢ Tweet at official support account
   ‚Ä¢ Message on other platforms they manage

3. Document everything:
   ‚Ä¢ Screenshots
   ‚Ä¢ Support ticket numbers
   ‚Ä¢ Communication history

4. Consider:
   ‚Ä¢ Create new account and warn contacts
   ‚Ä¢ Report to FTC if scammer is using your account

exit_pyramid.message:
Exiting a pyramid scheme:

1. Stop recruiting immediately
2. Request refund (if within return period)
3. Warn your downline
4. Don't feel pressured by upline
5. Report to:
   ‚Ä¢ FTC: reportfraud.ftc.gov
   ‚Ä¢ State Attorney General
   ‚Ä¢ Better Business Bureau

6. Learn from experience - you're not alone!

Most people lose money in MLMs/pyramids. The system is designed that way. Don't blame yourself!

options.text: Can I get my money back?

password_manager.message:
Password managers explained:

What they do:
‚Ä¢ Store all passwords securely
‚Ä¢ Generate strong random passwords
‚Ä¢ Auto-fill login forms
‚Ä¢ Sync across devices
‚Ä¢ Alert you to breaches

Popular options:
‚Ä¢ 1Password ($2.99/month)
‚Ä¢ Bitwarden (Free or $10/year)
‚Ä¢ LastPass (Free or $3/month)
‚Ä¢ Dashlane ($4.99/month)

How it works:
‚Ä¢ You remember ONE master password
‚Ä¢ It remembers all others
‚Ä¢ Encrypted and secure

Much safer than reusing passwords or writing them down!

options.text: How do I create strong passwords?

file_complaint.message:
How to file official complaints:

üìù FTC (Federal Trade Commission):
‚Ä¢ Website: reportfraud.ftc.gov
‚Ä¢ Phone: 1-877-FTC-HELP
‚Ä¢ Covers: scams, fraud, identity theft

üìù FCC (Federal Communications Commission):
‚Ä¢ Website: consumercomplaints.fcc.gov
‚Ä¢ Covers: unwanted calls, texts, robocalls

üìù IC3 (Internet Crime Complaint Center):
‚Ä¢ Website: ic3.gov
‚Ä¢ FBI-operated
‚Ä¢ Covers: internet crimes

üìù State Attorney General:
‚Ä¢ Google: '[Your State] Attorney General consumer complaints'

File with all relevant agencies!

pyramid_refund.message:
Getting money back from MLM/pyramid:

‚úÖ You might get refund if:
‚Ä¢ Within return period (usually 30-90 days)
‚Ä¢ Product unopened/unused
‚Ä¢ Have original receipt
‚Ä¢ Company has buyback policy

‚ö†Ô∏è Harder to recover:
‚Ä¢ Training materials purchased
‚Ä¢ Event tickets
‚Ä¢ Samples you bought
‚Ä¢ Inventory you sold

Steps:
1. Read return policy carefully
2. Request refund in writing
3. Send certified mail
4. If denied, file complaint with FTC
5. Consider small claims court
6. Report to Attorney General

Many legitimate MLMs have mandatory buyback policies!
